Description: Fragment of shoulder of East Greek pottery closed vase, probably oenochoe. Clay brown, micaceous, rather coarse textured; creamy yellow slip on outside. Two lines above; part of a frieze, with only filling ornament preserved (triangle, circle, and swastika patterns and a small cross with four blobs). Inside reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Hayes (1992 p. 204 no. N3): "'Milesian fabric' cf. that of complete vessels 75 and 76. If the triangle is set vertically, the two bands become part of the decoration.
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 204 no. N3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.844)
